response.answer_text: Depends how you think about it. It has an amazing double meaning. For example “Mother Mary, won’t you whisper, something but the past is done.” If you see it as a command towards Mary, then it might be. However, Maynard has said that the song is about somebody who is only interesting when drunk, and boring when sober. When looked at this way, it is more likely that “Mother Mary” or “Jesus” are simply exclamations. This said, their song “Opiate” is certainly anti-religious.
